data.title: 500 years since the death of Leonardo da Vinci: major events around the world
data.meta_description: Poster of events for the 500th anniversary of the death of Leonardo da Vinci, the great Italian artist and inventor.
data.text:
The leading museums of Europe have prepared for this date expositions dedicated to his work. PRAGMATIKA.MEDIA compiled a small poster of the most important of them.

Exhibition Leonardo Da Vinci. Disegnare il futuro ("Leonardo da Vinci. Drawing the future")

Where: Royal Museum, Turin

When: from April 15 to July 14, 2019

An exhibition has started in the Royal Museum in Turin, where about 50 drawings by da Vinci are displayed, showing his research in the field of science. These works, dating from approximately 1488 to 1515. Among the exhibits are Leonardo's famous self-portrait (which is called the "Turin self-portrait"), studies for the lost fresco "Battle of Anghiari" and the painting "Madonna in the Rocks". In addition, a notebook with his notes "Codex on the flight of birds" will be exhibited.

Exhibition Leonardo Vive ("Leonardo lived")

Where: Museo Ideale Leonardo da Vinci, Vinci

When: from May 2 to December 31, 2019

In Vinci, Leonardo's hometown, they also prepared for a unique anniversary. As part of the Leonardo Vive exhibition, two Italian experts are going to conduct a DNA test on a strand of hair, which is believed to have belonged to the artist. The thread was found in a private collection in the USA and will be shown to the general public for the first time. The test may resolve the dispute regarding the alleged remains of Leonardo, which are kept in the castle of Amboise in France.

Opening of Sala delle Assi (Board Hall) after restoration

Where: Castello Sforzesco, Milan

When: from May 16, 2019 to January 12, 2020

Restoration of the Board Room in Sforza Castle, the ceiling of which was painted by Leonardo da Vinci, began back in 2013. In mid-May, it will finally open to the public. At the same time, the castle is preparing exhibitions dedicated to the 500th anniversary of the master's death. The exhibition "Leonardo and Sala delle Asse between nature, art and science" will bring together drawings and sketches by da Vinci and other Renaissance artists. A multimedia exhibition will be held in the armory, which will show what Milan was like in Leonardo's time.

Documentary film "Leonardo 500 / Leonardo 500"

Where: "Kyiv" cinema, Kyiv

When: May 23, 2019, 19:00–20:30

In honor of the 500th anniversary of the master's death, the documentary film "Leonardo 500" by Francesco Invernizza will be screened at the "Kyiv" cinema. A series of interviews with famous historians and successful entrepreneurs allows us to understand how da Vinci's ideas remain relevant to this day, influencing today's business and science.

Exhibition Leonardo da Vinci: A Life in Drawing ("Leonardo da Vinci: life in drawing")

Where: Royal Gallery at Buckingham Palace, London

When: from May 24 to October 13, 2019

In London, a large exhibition was also prepared for the landmark date, which will bring together up to 200 drawings by the Renaissance master. According to the curators of the exhibition, these works provide an understanding of Leonardo's mindset and reflect the entire range of his interests, including painting, sculpture, architecture, anatomy, engineering, cartography, geology and botany.

Retrospective exhibition Leonardo da Vinci ("Leonardo da Vinci")

Where: Louvre, Paris

When: from October 24, 2019 to February 24, 2020

The curators of the future exhibition set themselves the goal of collecting the largest number of works by da Vinci. Along with the Mona Lisa, the museum owns four other works recognized as paintings by Leonardo. These are "Madonna in the Rocks", "Beautiful Ferroniere", "John the Baptist" and "Saint Anne". Along with these paintings, the Louvre plans to show many of his drawings. The retrospective should demonstrate the importance of painting in the study of Leonardo's world.
